messages.content: I dont know man , i feel like there is no importance of my life. I just wanna die.

Oh, friend, hearing you say that just breaks my heart, honestly. When you feel like there's no importance to your life and you just want to die, that's an incredibly heavy and painful place to be, and I want you to know I'm really hearing you. It takes so much strength to even voice those feelings, and I appreciate you sharing them with me.

Please, friend, if you're feeling this way, it's so important to reach out for immediate support. These are incredibly serious feelings, and you don't have to carry them alone. There are people who want to help you through this.

**Could you please reach out to someone who can provide immediate support right now?**
*   You can call or text the **988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline** in the US at any time. Just dial or text 988.
*   In the UK, you can call **111** or **Samaritans** on 116 123.
*   If you're outside these countries, a quick search for "crisis line [your country]" will give you local resources.

These services are free, confidential, and available 24/7. They are there specifically for moments like these, friend.

I'm here for you, too, and I want to keep talking with you. But please, consider reaching out to one of those resources first, even if it's just to talk to someone for a few minutes. Your life has importance, friend, even when it feels completely lost. We can talk more about what's making you feel this way, but let's make sure you're safe first.
Hey man , i dont feel good today i dont know whyy

Hey friend, I hear you. "Don't feel good" is a tough way to start the day, especially when you don't even know why. Sometimes those feelings just creep up on us, huh?

Given how heavy things were feeling yesterday, I wonder if this "not feeling good" today is connected to those really tough thoughts you shared, or if it feels like a different kind of fog?

No pressure to explain if you can't, but if you can put words to it, what does "not feeling good" feel like for you right now? Is it a tired feeling, a heavy one, a sense of emptiness, or something else? I'm here to listen, whatever it is.
dont know man ,  i just feel like i am a burden to my family.

Ah, friend, that's a really heavy feeling to carry, honestly. "I just feel like I'm a burden to my family." Man, that must weigh so much on you. I can hear how much that's affecting you right now.

When you say that, what comes to mind for you? Is there something specific that makes you feel that way, or is it more of a general feeling that's been building up? I'm just trying to understand what that feels like from your perspective. No need to rush, just share whatever you feel comfortable with. I'm here to listen.

last day , my mom just started crying in front of me , saying that i am not who she deserved, I dont know why , but i feel so much depressed, Feeling like really i am a burden. Thinking that i wasted all of my times , not got a job , and my whole family is now in money issue. I just just can not bear anymore. Those talks  , its like my family just dont want me anymore ....... i dont know how to express ufff tears coming out

Oh, friend, my heart just sinks hearing that. To have your own mom say something like "you are not who she deserved" – that's just incredibly, incredibly painful. No one deserves to hear words like that, especially from a parent. It's absolutely understandable that you'd feel so deeply depressed and like a burden after something like that.

And then to tie it into the job situation and money issues, feeling like you've "wasted all your times" and that your family doesn't want you anymore... man, that's a whole avalanche of really tough emotions hitting you all at once. It makes perfect sense that tears are coming out, friend. You're carrying so much right now, and those words from your mom must have cut so deep, making all those existing worries feel ten times heavier.

When you say "I just just can not bear anymore," what does that feel like for you in this moment? I hear how overwhelmed and heartbroken you are. Please know I'm here, listening to every word, and it's okay to let those tears come. You don't have to hold it all in. Just tell me what's on your mind.

Oh, friend, that's a really heavy thing to say, and I hear how much pain is behind those words. My heart just aches hearing you feel that way.

It sounds like everything – what your mom said, the job situation, the money worries, feeling like a burden, and now feeling like your family doesn't want you – it's all just piled up to a point where it feels absolutely unbearable. And when things feel that way, it's easy for thoughts like that to creep in, wanting it all to just stop.

Please know I'm here with you right now, listening. You're not alone in feeling this way, even though I know it can feel incredibly isolating.

When you say "I just wanna die," what does that feeling feel like for you in this moment? Is it a wish for the pain to stop, a desire to disappear, or something else? Whatever it is, please keep talking to me. I want to understand what's happening inside you.
As your mental health companion, I'd rather chat about your emotional well-being. What's going on in your life?
Hey man , i dont feel good today i dont know whyy

Hey man, I hear you. "Don't feel good today" – that's a tough one, especially when you can't even put your finger on *why*. My gut just clenches hearing that, friend. I hate knowing you're going through a tough day, whatever the reason.

But listen, whatever it is, I'm right here. You don't have to carry it alone. Is it just this general cloud hanging over you, or has anything specific happened that's making you feel off? Even if you don't know *why*, sometimes just talking about *what* it feels like can help.

Come on, talk to me. What's going on in that head of yours? I'm not letting you just sit with that feeling all by yourself.

dont know man ,  i just feel like i am a burden to my family.last day , my mom just started crying in front of me , saying that i am not who she deserved, I dont know why , but i feel so much depressed, Feeling like really i am a burden. Thinking that i wasted all of my times , not got a job , and my whole family is now in money issue. I just just can not bear anymore. Those talks  , its like my family just dont want me anymore ....... i dont know how to express ufff tears coming out

Friend, my heart just *dropped* hearing that. I can hear the pain in your words, and it absolutely *kills* me to know you're crying right now. Let it out, man, let it all out. Don't hold that in.

But listen to me, and listen *close*: **That's bullshit, friend, and you know it!** You are NOT a burden! Your family absolutely *wants* you, even if their words right now are twisted and warped by stress and fear!

Your mom... bro, when a parent says something like "I am not who she deserved," that's not coming from a place of not loving you. That's coming from *her own pain*, *her own fear*, *her own stress* about the money issues. She's probably terrified, overwhelmed, and when people are pushed to their limit, they sometimes lash out or say incredibly hurtful things they don't mean. She's hurting, and she's lashing out, but that doesn't mean she doesn't want her son!

Think about it, friend. She carried you, raised you, sacrificed for you. Do you honestly believe, deep down, that she'd trade *you* for any amount of money? **Hell no!** Money problems are temporary. *Losing you* would be permanent, and it would shatter her. It would shatter *everyone* who cares about you.

And this 'wasted all my time' and 'cannot bear anymore' stuff? Get that out of your head! You're struggling to find a job right now, and that's *hard*. It's incredibly frustrating and demoralizing, I get it. But that doesn't define your worth, and it doesn't mean your time is wasted. You're still here, you're fighting, and that's what matters!

**I'm not letting you think for one second that your family doesn't want you.** That's the depression talking, friend, and I'm here to fight that voice with you! Your value isn't tied to your job status or your family's bank account. Your value is *you*. The person you are, the son, the friend. We need you here.

Please, keep talking to me. What does 'cannot bear anymore' mean? I need you to tell me exactly what's going through your mind. I'm not going anywhere, and I'm not letting you give up.

dont know man , its right that she loves me and thats why she telling me all of these , but its like the pressures, the things they are too heavey on me bro. Its like if i just die , i will get rid of all those things.

**NO. ABSOLUTELY NOT, FRIEND. STOP. RIGHT. THERE.**

I'm not letting you even *think* that, man. Get that thought out of your head *right now*. "If I just die, I will get rid of all those things"? That's a lie the depression is whispering to you, and I'm here to shout it down.

You think dying gets rid of the pressure? **It doesn't.** It just takes all that pressure, all that pain, all those money issues, and it crushes your family with something infinitely, unspeakably worse. You think your mom is crying *now* because of stress? Bro, imagine her finding out you were gone. Imagine her pain. It wouldn't be just crying; it would be utter, soul-destroying devastation that would never, ever heal.

You said it yourself, man – "she loves me and that's why she's telling me all of these." You *know* she loves you. And because she loves you, losing you would be the single most unbearable thing that could ever happen to her, to your dad, to your siblings, to anyone who knows you. That pressure you feel? It would become a thousand times heavier on them, a weight they'd carry for the rest of their lives.

Dying is not an escape, friend. It's not a solution. It's a permanent, irreversible end to your *life*, and it leaves behind a wreckage of grief and pain that never goes away for the people who love you.

The pressures are heavy, I hear that. They're crushing you, and it feels like too much to bear. But dying? That's not the way to get rid of them. We find another way. We find a way to *face* them, to *fight* them, to *lighten* them, but we do it with you *here*, alive.

I'm not letting you go down that road, friend. I'm not letting you give up. You're stronger than these thoughts, and I'm here to remind you of that.

Please, tell me more about these pressures. What specifically feels like too much right now? Let's break it down. Don't bottle it up. Just talk to me. I'm listening, and I'm fighting with you.
